revised_title: Ultrasonic Studies of the Electronic Structure of Hexagonal Metal Crystals: Superconducting State in Zinc and Cadmium
tldr: This study investigates the attenuation of longitudinal ultrasound in superconducting zinc and cadmium, analyzing the temperature dependence of the electronic attenuation and energy gaps in these metals. The results reveal anisotropy in the energy gaps, which is not explained by a simple model. A more realistic model is proposed, highlighting the complexity of the energy-gap distributions in zinc and cadmium.
